publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3068 Phil Gallie: Pardon for William Wallace-That the Parliament recommends that, as the 700th anniversary of the execution of Sir William Wallace approaches, a posthumous pardon for the charge of treason laid against him be granted and that he be recognised as a patriot loyal to his country in the days before the Union of the Crowns and the Union of the Parliaments. Supported by: Alex Fergusson*, Murdo Fraser*, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*, Bill Aitken*, Mr David Davidson*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Mary Scanlon*, Alex Johnstone*, Ben Wallace*, Mr Keith Harding*, John Scott*
S1M-3068 Pardon for William Wallace (lodged on 7 May 2002) Mr Jamie McGrigor*, John Young*, David Mundell*

S1M-3068 Phil Gallie: Pardon for William Wallace-That the Parliament recommends that, as the 700th anniversary of the execution of Sir William Wallace approaches, a posthumous pardon for the charge of treason laid against him be granted and that he be recognised as a patriot loyal to his country in the days before the Union of the Crowns and the Union of the Parliaments. Supported by: Alex Fergusson, Murdo Fraser, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Bill Aitken, Mr David Davidson, Mr Brian Monteith, Mary Scanlon, Alex Johnstone, Ben Wallace, Mr Keith Harding, John Scott, Mr Jamie McGrigor, John Young, David Mundell
